Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that is healthy and growing with plenty of water and light.
The student can draw a plant that is wilted or unhealthy without enough water.
The student can draw a plant that does not grow if it is placed in the dark with no light.
The student can show through their drawings that patterns in how plants look can be used to understand their need for water and light.
The student can illustrate the difference in plant conditions when water and light needs are met versus when they are not.
